definition: (fig.) to have a meeting with state security agents (to be warned to behave "responsibly")

sentences.english: On this organisgotd with the sea! the pandas like to drink tea with pelike in soda.
sentences.chinese: 在海里的這個區域，熊貓們喜歡就着蘇打碗豆喝茶。

sentences.english: While we have been at sea, Jeanie has been working on a seal skin.
sentences.chinese: 在我們喝茶的時候，珍妮正在加工一張海豹皮。

sentences.english: And that, his father and I sat by the side of his private Diaojiao house and chatted over tea.
sentences.chinese: 他阿爸拉我在自家的吊腳樓前邊聊邊喝茶。

sentences.english: An egg had tea in a caff , as a result, it became a tea-leaf egg.
sentences.chinese: 有一個雞蛋去茶館喝茶，結果它變成了茶葉蛋。

sentences.english: But I really love to have after-meal tea.
sentences.chinese: 不過我特別喜歡在飯後喝茶。

sentences.english: How about going to the teahouse at Wangjiang Tower Park?
sentences.chinese: 去望江公園的老茶館喝茶怎麼樣？

sentences.english: The company, too, must be small. For, "it is important in drinking tea that the guests be few."
sentences.chinese: 同時，喝茶的友伴也不可多，“因爲飲茶以客少爲貴。

sentences.english: All around the world, people drink tea.
sentences.chinese: 全世界所有的人都喝茶。

sentences.english: I don't drink tea. I do eat biscuits though.
sentences.chinese: 我不喝茶，不過我會喫餅乾。

sentences.english: Please don't drink tea in class.
Would you like tea or coffee?
They had a chat over a cup of tea.
We stopped for tea in the park and we hired a small boat.
sentences.chinese: 我們在公園裏喝茶，我們還租了一條小船。

sentences.english: Abbot see this old instrument out of the ordinary, they invited him to To the temple to drink tea.
sentences.chinese: 方丈見這老人儀表不凡，便邀他到寺裏喝茶。

sentences.english: Tea drinkers, in contrast, had longer and more restful slumbers.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，喝茶的人睡得更久更香。

sentences.english: There is no coffee. Woule you like a cup of tea instead?
sentences.chinese: 沒有咖啡了。你要不要改成喝茶？

definition: to have tea and refreshments/to have dimsum lunch (Cantonese)
very concentrated type of tea drunk in Chaozhou, Fujian and Taiwan
tea prepared in large quantity using inexpensive tea leaves
